issue.title: [Rust] Use "if cfg!" pattern in SIMD kernel implementations
issue.body:
***Note**: This issue was originally created as [ARROW-6408](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-6408). Please see the [migration documentation](https://gist.github.com/toddfarmer/12aa88361532d21902818a6044fda4c3) for further details.*

### Original Issue Description:
There are a few places in the SIMD kernels where we have to use "#[allow(unreachable_code)]".  In these cases it would be better to use the "if cfg!" pattern

comments.body:
***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-6408?focusedCommentId=16923824) by Hengruo Zhang (hengruo):*
Hi, I am starting to walk through the Rust codebase and would like to contribute. I think this ticket is a good entry point. Here is my PR: <https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/5303>

Any comments are welcome. Thanks!

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-6408?focusedCommentId=16925251) by Neville Dipale (nevi_me):*
Issue resolved by pull request 5303
<https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/5303>
